required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exploring Hand Function in People With Schizophrenia Based on Perspective of Sensorimotor Control
clinical_study.official_title: Exploration of the Relationships Between Vocational Performances Ans Sensorimotor Factors of Hands in Schizophrenia

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to explore the hand function in people with schizophrenia in the chronic stage.

primary_outcome.description: Semmes Weinstein Monofilaments is used to assess cutaneous pressure thresholds.
The pinch apparatus is aims to assess the ability to modulate pinch force to movement-induced load fluctuations in a pinch-holding-up activity (PHUA).
Manual tactile test (MTT) aims to assess the capacity of barognosis, roughness differentiation and stereognosis.
The purpose for Purdue pegboard test is to measure manipulative dexterity including unimanual and bimanual hand dexterity.

primary_outcome.measure: The Valpar 8 simulates assembly work assessment
primary_outcome.description: Valpar8 simulates the light work and assess the ability of manual dexterity and motor coordination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-reported version of the graphic Personal and Social Performance (SRG-PSP)
secondary_outcome.description: The self-reported version of the graphic personal and social performance is a self-report scale that aims to assess functional performance.

arm_group.description: No intervention age between 20-65, diagnosed schizophrenia by DSM-5.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with schizophrenia will be recruited from the Department of Internal Medicine in National Cheng Kung University Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 20-65 years old
- Diagnosis with schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder by psychiatrists according to DSM5.
- Remaining the same antipsychotics and the symptom was stable for at least one month before the study.
- Be able to follow comments and have sufficient cognitive ability assessed by Mini-Mental State Examination score >24
Exclusion Criteria:
- Substance abuse or other medical conditions that may affect movements.
- Using other non-antipsychotics that will affect movements in the same period.
